name: places/ChIJNdgJxZZZwokRv1Q9GB8FdrE
formattedAddress: 49 W 8th St #1, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 49 W 8th St #1, New York, NY 10011-9025, USA

originalText.text: I’ve been going to this place for years and sent so many of my friends here. I’ve woken up before and barely been able to move my neck, called them and they’d fit me in almost immediately. Even a quick 30 minute back massage on the chair is amazing if you don’t have time for the full hour on the table. Couldn’t recommend more.

Even a quick 30 minute back massage on the chair is amazing if you don’t have time for the full hour on the table. Couldn’t recommend more.

originalText.text:
I’ve been here about 5 times now. I have also brought a few of my friends on a few occasions who thoroughly enjoyed it. The price for a full hour body massage is quite a steal. What I don’t understand are the complaints.

As an example: “The pressure was too hard and the masseuse or masseur do not speak english. It is 2024 right? Smart phones are a great tool for translation.

Tipping: This is not a restaurant. Please acknowledge that they are physically working hard to try to take your tensions away. A normal tip is 30% plus. I am not trying to neglect those that had a bad experience and tipped little. But there are too many bad reviews saying, “the massage was great but they asked for more tips.”

In addition, communicate more. Use google translate and make sure your request is understood. The reception also speaks english and can assist. There are just too many outlets for communication for this to be an excuse.

I usually don’t write reviews, but the workers here(I’ll admit there are a couple that are sassy) are hard working people. Please don’t punish them. I feel like I have to write this review to defend the hard working people here.

Get a massage. Relax. It’s your time to yourself. Try to forget all of the pressure the world has rest upon you and enjoy it.

Finally, ask for ALAN! He truly is the best. I use my Google translate all the time to communicate with him. This guy can take away all the knots. I always feel renewed when I go to my soccer games and practices. Cheers!

originalText.text: Wow just wow. I needed a good deep tissue massage and came here after some research. They were open late and had a $39 offer for a one hour full body massage. Paul was my therapist and he was great. He worked on most of the knots I had, he used hot stones and hot towels. They offer foot reflexology and private divided rooms for comfort. I was able to hear people talking in the other rooms but overall was nice with the relaxing music. Definitely recommend for price.

text.text: Wow just wow. I needed a good deep tissue massage and came here after some research. They were open late and had a $39 offer for a one hour full body massage. Paul was my therapist and he was great. He worked on most of the knots I had, he used hot stones and hot towels. They offer foot reflexology and private divided rooms for comfort. I was able to hear people talking in the other rooms but overall was nice with the relaxing music. Definitely recommend for price.

originalText.text:
Unprofessional and rude staff. I had the worst experience with massage, too. I was told over the phone to pay $39 in cash after the massage, with no mention of any extra charges. The rude female manager at the reception pressured me to pay the extra tip and started teaching me the ethics of using the services in the USA in front of her other clients. As a student, I only sometimes carried extra cash or my card, but not today since I only had $39 to pay at the counter. I told her this, but she said you must pay today. This was an embarrassing moment for me as she used rude language as if I had committed a crime for not paying the tip at the counter.

Moreover, the massage therapist didn't know how to speak English, so I used sign language. She was just ok, and put significantly extra pressure on my back and now after few hours of passing by, I have extreme pain on my back unfortunately. This was my first experience with massage in the USA, and it was pathetic, tbh.

I won't recommend their services since they don't keep up with their word or disclose complete information beforehand.

originalText.text: I have a mixed opinion about this. Sometimes it felt good, but the employee was liteeally burping while massaging. Also, sometimes it hurted because it was too hard and I woke up the day after with a terrible back pain. I am quite sure that this is not what massages are for. Also, we were told to pay cash and came with the right amount of money and were assaulted because we didn’t left enough tip.
